last_episode_to_air.name: Determination
last_episode_to_air.overview: Haseo reappears after his hiatus only to receive devastating news about Phyllo. Tabby finally discovers the confidence to make her own decisions, and informs Haseo she has decided to become a nurse in order to save Shino. Now, Haseo is alone with only his memories to keep him company.

name: .hack
overview: .hack follows several young players as they navigate the vast, mysterious MMORPG known as “The World” – a place, it turns out, that is sometimes impossible to leave.

seasons.name: .hack//SIGN
seasons.overview: Tsukasa wakes up inside The World, a massive online role-playing game full of magic and monsters, and finds himself unable to log out. With no knowledge of what’s happening in the real world, Tsukasa must discover how he ended up stuck in the game, and what connection he has with the fabled Key of the Twilight—an item that’s rumored to grant ultimate control over the digital realm.

seasons.name: .hack//Legend of the Twilight
seasons.overview: Rena and her twin brother Shugo enter The World, a massive online RPG. Playing as the limited edition characters Kite and Black Rose, the siblings encounter powerful monsters capable of sending players into real world comas. To save themselves—and The World—Shugo and Rena must unlock the secrets of the mysterious twilight bracelet before it’s too late!

seasons.name: .hack//Roots
seasons.overview: In the newest version of the massive online RPG know as “The World,” Haseo and his guild mates search for a legendary item called the Key of the Twilight—but they’re not the only ones looking for it. When a rival guild faces off against Haseo and his teammates, the conflict has deep repercussions both inside and outside the game, and threatens to leave the players forever changed.

episodes.name: Role Play
episodes.overview: Tsukasa is trapped in an MMORPG called The World. With his conscious inaccessible, Tsukasa attempts to find his purpose for being in the game.

episodes.name: Guardian
episodes.overview: Tsukasa’s inability to log out of the world worries Mimiru. The Crimson Knights, on the other hand, see Tsukasa as a threat.

episodes.name: Folklore
episodes.overview: BT and Sora suspect that Tsukasa is somehow connected to a very important artifact, the Key of the Twilight.

episodes.name: Wanted
episodes.overview: Tsukasa's rampaging Guardian monster wreaks havoc in The World, and an edict from Subaru makes him a wanted man.

episodes.name: Captured
episodes.overview: Tsukasa finally tames his Guardian monster, but unbeknownst to him, someone is plotting his capture.

episodes.name: Encounter
episodes.overview: Subaru carefully observes Tsukasa, gradually getting to know him. Sora mounts a rescue mission.

episodes.name: Reason
episodes.overview: Mimiru encounters a novice player and offers her guidance in The World. This new relationship helps Mimiru uncover her own motivation for playing.

episodes.name: Promise
episodes.overview: Mimiru extends Tsukasa an invitation to meet; BT and Crim share an interesting encounter.

episodes.name: Epitaph
episodes.overview: An elite hacker proves instrumental in the quest for the Key of the Twilight, and Tsukasa gets stuck with a sick Grunty.

episodes.name: Compensation
episodes.overview: Bear's shortcomings as a father may be the root of his concern for Tsukasa. Clues arise as the search for the Key of the Twilight continues.

episodes.name: Party
episodes.overview: Mimiru, Bear, and Tsukasa join forces before embarking on a non-fighting quest.

episodes.name: Entanglement
episodes.overview: Tsukasa stumbles upon Aura, an advanced AI, that is being held captive.

episodes.name: Twilight Eye
episodes.overview: A way to open the Twilight Eye is discovered, and the group decides to follow the new path unfolding before them.

episodes.name: Castle
episodes.overview: After the Eye is opened, a secret area appears, complicating the group's search for the key.

episodes.name: Evidence
episodes.overview: Revisit all the major moments from this groundbreaking anime in a series of vivid flashbacks that may shed new light on past events!

episodes.name: Depth
episodes.overview: Tsukasa logs back into The World, only to discover that he cannot die. Shocked, he turns to Subaru for answers.

episodes.name: Conflict
episodes.overview: Crim refuses to meet BT outside of the game. Later, Tsukasa mounts a rescue attempt – and secrets are revealed.

episodes.name: Declaration
episodes.overview: Silver Knight disrupts any and all potential rendezvous between Subaru and Tsukasa. Subaru ponders the future of the Crimson Knights.

episodes.name: Recollection
episodes.overview: Subaru drifts aimlessly through The World, reflecting on her past experiences. Her connection with Tsukasa grows even stronger after an unexpected attack.

episodes.name: Tempest
episodes.overview: Aura goes missing, Morganna attacks Tsukasa, and the search for the Key of the Twilight continues.

episodes.name: Despair
episodes.overview: Tsukasa lingers in a catatonic state, and some immensely powerful monsters make their presence felt in The World.

episodes.name: Phantom
episodes.overview: Bear, Mimiru, and Subaru are attacked by yet another seemingly-unstoppable monster, but Balmung comes to the rescue.

episodes.name: The Eve
episodes.overview: Tsukasa is too frightened to pass through Helba's gate, and Crim explains Subaru's true life condition.

episodes.name: Net Slum
episodes.overview: Upon arriving in Helba's realm – Net Slum – the group is forced to defend Subaru from an attack by Morganna.

episodes.name: Catastrophe
episodes.overview: As the battle intensifies, the group seeks shelter in the Cathedral. Morganna summons Guardians to do her bidding.

episodes.name: Return
episodes.overview: Drawing strength from Subaru, Tsukasa summons the courage to awaken Aura. Outside of The World, players share a true life encounter.

1.name: .hack//SIGN
1.overview: Tsukasa wakes up inside The World, a massive online role-playing game full of magic and monsters, and finds himself unable to log out. With no knowledge of what’s happening in the real world, Tsukasa must discover how he ended up stuck in the game, and what connection he has with the fabled Key of the Twilight—an item that’s rumored to grant ultimate control over the digital realm.

episodes.name: The Legendary Hero
episodes.overview: After winning a contest, twins Shugo and Rena enter The World as legendary hacker characters. Shugo is defeated by an unexpectedly powerful monster, which leads to his resurrection by a mysterious woman.

episodes.name: Kite’s Bracelet
episodes.overview: Balmung decides to throw an event to make cherry blossom trees bloom, which Shugo, Rena, and their new sidekick Mireille decide to attend. After a monster appears, Shugo must rely on a furry friend for help in battle.

episodes.name: The Phoenix Feather
episodes.overview: Shugo levels up by letting the members in his party do all the work. Next, he helps another player whose sick grunty can only be cured with an item located in a dangerous part of The World.

episodes.name: Tanabata Night
episodes.overview: Sanjuro begins to train Shugo, and Rena is selected as the damsel in distress in an event that can make wishes come true.

episodes.name: Mansion of Terror
episodes.overview: Rena falls into a trap that was intended for Shugo. Her disappearance leaves the group wondering where she’s gone.

episodes.name: Trap of the Hot Steaming Water
episodes.overview: The search for Rena begins. A mysterious message leads the search party to a dangerous location. The party is caught off guard by heartbreaking news.

episodes.name: Twilight Moon
episodes.overview: Rena remains in a comatose state and is unable to log out of The World. Balmung reveals that several other users have been affected in a similar way.

episodes.name: The Solitary Knight
episodes.overview: Balmung has his role as an administrator taken away, and Rena attempts to contact Shugo with the help of Aura.

episodes.name: Footsteps of Collapse
episodes.overview: Shugo uses a new ability to try and reach Rena. The two are almost united, but a rogue AI complicates the situation.

episodes.name: Capital of Illusion
episodes.overview: Shugo continues his training with the group, and their teamwork is tested by the appearance of a new monster.

episodes.name: The End of the World
episodes.overview: After fending off a dangerous wave of attacks, the group learns of Aura’s plan to maintain the balance of The World through the use of unconventional methods.

episodes.name: The Legend Begins
episodes.overview: A virus prevents the party from achieving victory in battle. With data drain left as the only option, Shugo must use his abilities like never before to save Rena.

2.name: .hack//Legend of the Twilight
2.overview: Rena and her twin brother Shugo enter The World, a massive online RPG. Playing as the limited edition characters Kite and Black Rose, the siblings encounter powerful monsters capable of sending players into real world comas. To save themselves—and The World—Shugo and Rena must unlock the secrets of the mysterious twilight bracelet before it’s too late!

episodes.name: Welcome to "The World"
episodes.overview: Haseo's entrance into The World is marked by a hostile attack – and a crushing defeat. His adventure appears to be over before it started until a mysterious stranger gives him new life.

episodes.name: Twilight Brigade
episodes.overview: His search for information about his mysterious savior leads to an invitation for Haseo to join Ovan’s guild.

episodes.name: Join
episodes.overview: Rumors being spread about Haseo lead to attacks against him. Invitations to join two separate guilds intrigue him, but an encounter with Shino will influence his choice.

episodes.name: Fore Feel
episodes.overview: Haseo embarks on a journey through the game on a quest to level up, Sakisaka grows suspicious, and Tabby meets an untimely end.

episodes.name: Distrust
episodes.overview: Haseo is suspected of acting as a spy, putting him at odds with the Twilight Bridgade. His actions after the falling out only serve to further implicate him.

episodes.name: Conflict
episodes.overview: Concerns over Sakisaka’s loyalty arise, The World experiences technical difficulties, and Haseo unveils a few new tricks.

episodes.name: Intrigue
episodes.overview: Strange occurrences plague The World as Haseo wanders the Lost Grounds. Later, a group exploration leads to shocking new knowledge and a sudden disappearance!

episodes.name: Starting
episodes.overview: The group stumbles upon a portal, Haseo shares an encounter with Ender, and more is learned about the virus cores.

episodes.name: Melee
episodes.overview: While attempting to collect all the Virus Cores, the Twilight Brigade is attacked by adversaries – and relocated to a mysterious, unknown area.

episodes.name: Missing
episodes.overview: Ovan wanders into a trap while searching for the Key of Twilight. Shino, in an attempt to secure Ovan’s release, makes a bold threat!

episodes.name: Discord
episodes.overview: Gord gives serious thought to leaving The World for good, and the administrators take serious action against some online outlaws.

episodes.name: Breakup
episodes.overview: The Twilight Brigade is forcibly disbanded, Gord finally arrives at a decision regarding his involvement in The World, and Haseo makes a vow to Shino.

episodes.name: Tragedy
episodes.overview: Tabby has some shocking news for Haseo, and Shino’s precious data beings to disappear.

episodes.name: Unreturner
episodes.overview: Haseo is devastated about his inability to prevent Shino from falling into a comatose state. Tabby has plans for a new guild, but its lack of members is troubling.

episodes.name: Pad
episodes.overview: Tabby encounters two players who are new to The World. Later, she learns the secrets to leveling up, and Haseo embarks on a quest for revenge.

episodes.name: Resolution
episodes.overview: Phyllo attempts to comfort Haseo, who continues to agonize over his comatose friend. A dangerous new quest – and the promise of newfound power – tempts Haseo.

episodes.name: Painful Forest
episodes.overview: Tabby’s been worried about Haseo since his departure to the Forest of Pain. She expresses her concern to Subaro, who is instructed by Pi to follow Haseo into the forest. Meanwhile, Yata and Pi prod Phyllo for information about his relationship with Ovan.

episodes.name: Limit
episodes.overview: Tabby is still struggling with her inability to help Haseo in the Forest of Pain. In the forest, Haseo grows frustrated with the ever-growing amount of monsters he must fight before going deeper, but his quest for more power may be his downfall.

episodes.name: Violation
episodes.overview: Tawaraya returns unde the moniker “Tohta” to discover a gang of money traders has been flooding the market, creating high inflation. Despite his quest for secrecy, Tohta can’t stand back and let the money traders fleece innocent players, and decides to intervene.

episodes.name: Pursuit
episodes.overview: As Haseo’s search for information about Tri-Edge continues, his sanity begins to slip away, and in a murderous rage he kills several PKs. Yata and Pi are still on the hunt for Haseo’s factor. They send Subaro to retrieve it, but she can’t overcome Haseo’s manic strength.

episodes.name: Defeat
episodes.overview: A mysterious new player, Midori, has started a “hit-me-if-you-can” service. Haseo, still in the grips of manic power, enlists her services in order to discover Tri-Edge’s whereabouts. Meanwhile, Tohka encourages Tabby to start her own guild.

episodes.name: Bonds
episodes.overview: Tabby starts a new healing guild, but so far they haven’t had much success. Tohka points out that their levels are way to low to help anyone, and demands they go out and raise them. Haseo finally makes an appearance in town, and Phyllo warns him about the dangers of being single-minded.

episodes.name: Trial
episodes.overview: Haseo, consumed by a violent mania, will stop at nothing to find Tri-Edge, even it if means slaughtering any Player Killer who steps in his way. But while on his murderous rampage he’s left behind a trail of PK enemies who band together to stop him.

episodes.name: Confront
episodes.overview: After brutally slaughtering all the PKers, Haseo earns the nickname “The Terror of Death.” Still in the grips of insanity, Haseo refuses help or warnings from his old guild. But when Haseo finally encounters Tri-Edge, will he able to carry out his plan?

episodes.name: Truth
episodes.overview: There’s been no sign of Haseo for several days now, and rumors swirl that he’s quit for good. In his absence, Tabby has a realization, and also discovers a new love interest! Meanwhile, Phyllo divulges something shocking to Tohta.

episodes.name: Determination
episodes.overview: Haseo reappears after his hiatus only to receive devastating news about Phyllo. Tabby finally discovers the confidence to make her own decisions, and informs Haseo she has decided to become a nurse in order to save Shino. Now, Haseo is alone with only his memories to keep him company.

3.name: .hack//Roots
3.overview: In the newest version of the massive online RPG know as “The World,” Haseo and his guild mates search for a legendary item called the Key of the Twilight—but they’re not the only ones looking for it. When a rival guild faces off against Haseo and his teammates, the conflict has deep repercussions both inside and outside the game, and threatens to leave the players forever changed.
